channel.title: Title For This Feed
channel.description: This is a description of the feed to be shown in the RSS feed.

item.title: Draft Profile: Kevon Looney
item.description: If the Hawks take a chance on a high-risk, high-reward candidate during Thursday's draft, then a player whose name they may call is Kevon Looney of UCLA. Looney fits the bill, both in terms of the talents that the Hawks typically seek as the talents they may need to supplement their current roster. The 19-year-old is long, has shown a good touch from the outside, and can go an get a rebound in traffic.

item.title: Atlanta Hawks and Danny Ferry Part Ways
item.description: ATLANTA -- The Atlanta Hawks announced today that Danny Ferry has stepped down as General Manager of the team. The move follows an indefinite leave of absence Ferry began in August, at the request of the team. The leave was triggered by the unauthorized release of an audio recording containing a brief portion of a lengthy conference call with team ownership and others during which Ferry repeated and paraphrased language from a third-party scouting report that contained a culturally insensitive characterization of a player.

item.title: Draft Profile: Kelly Oubre
item.description: One of the benefits of the swapping picks with the Brooklyn Nets, and jumping from the 29th spot to the 15th pick in the draft, is that if things fall just right -- if a couple of teams draft for need and a few others miscalculate on player evaluation -- the Atlanta Hawks could end up with a top-10 talent. At times the 15th pick has yielded incredible talents who went overlooked by teams from the lottery. Giannis Antetokounmpo (2013), Kawhi Leonard (2011), and Steve Nash (1996) highlight the list.

item.title: Hawks' Top Blocks Of The Season
item.description: Check out the top 5 blocks from the Atlanta Hawks throughout the 2014-15 season.

item.title: Seven Teams Ahead of Hawks In Bovada's 2016 NBA Championship Odds
item.description: Bovada has already published odds to win the 2016 NBA Championship, and the Atlanta Hawks come in 8th place at 25:1. The Hawks were one of just two teams to win at least 60 games in 2014-15, earned the #1 seed in the Eastern Conference and made it to the Conference Finals. Despite the accomplishment Bovada has listed the Cavaliers, Warriors, Thunder, Bulls, Clippers, Spurs and Rockets as teams with a more likely chance to win the whole thing next season. The Hawks went 11-6 in the regular season against teams ahead of them on the list.

item.title: Best of Exit Interviews: Elton Brand
item.description: Elton Brand talks about this year's team, his career and his plans for next year during his exit interview.

item.title: Draft Profile: Is DeAndre Ayton The Next NBA Sensation?
item.description: The Hawks hold the rights to the #3, #19, #30 and #34 picks in the upcoming June 21 NBA Draft. At Hawks.com, we'll be talking to some of the writers and bloggers who watched some of this year's key prospects most closely.

item.title: Prince Is Proven: Taurean Prince's Top Plays of the Season
item.description: Taurean was the only Hawk to not only start, but play in all 82 games this season! Check out how much he has improved in his sophomore season.

item.title: NBA Lottery: There's A Chance
item.description: Check out Harry the Hawk go around the town seeing our odds for the NBA Draft!

item.title: John Collins Named To NBA All-Rookie Second Team
item.description: ATLANTA -– Atlanta Hawks forward/center John Collins has been named to the NBA All-Rookie Second Team, it was announced today by the NBA. Collins is the first Hawk since Al Horford (2007-08) to be named All-Rookie. The 19th overall pick by the Hawks in the 2017 NBA Draft, Collins averaged 10.5 points, 7.3 rebounds, 1.3 assists and 1.1 blocks in 24.1 minutes (.576 FG%, .340 3FG%, .715 FT%) in 74 contests (26 starts). He ranked seventh in the NBA in FG%, 10th in Eff. FG% (.591), tied for 25th in bpg and 33rd in rpg.

item.title: Hawks Recall Cavanaugh and Evans, Transfer Magette and White III to Atlanta
item.description: ATLANTA, GA -– The Atlanta Hawks Basketball Club has recalled forwards Tyler Cavanaugh and Jeremy Evans, and transferred guard Josh Magette and forward Andrew White III to Atlanta, from the Erie BayHawks, the team’s NBA G League affiliate, it was announced today. Magette and White III are on two-way contracts.

item.title: Malcolm Delaney Injury Update
item.description: ATLANTA -- Earlier today, Atlanta Hawks guard Malcolm Delaney underwent arthroscopic surgery on his left ankle at the Emory Orthopaedics & Spine Center. His expected recovery time is six-to-eight weeks.

item.title: Hawks Sign Damion Lee for Remainder of Season
item.description: ATLANTA -– The Atlanta Hawks Basketball Club has signed guard Damion Lee for the remainder of the season, it was announced today. Lee signed consecutive 10-day contracts on March 13 and March 23. Lee has appeared in 10 games (seven starts), averaging 9.8 points, 4.1 rebounds, 1.9 assists and 1.3 steals in 26.0 minutes.

item.title: Hawks Host Final Game Day Clinic of Season
item.description: We recently hosted our final Game Day Clinic, presented by Bank of America. In this final recap, Christopher tells us how he's following his dreams.
